Lectures

The lectures will be held in the Berger Auditorium (Room 207) of the McClelland building, on the UA campus. Here are directions.

Hotel

The conference hotel is the DoubleTree Hotel Tucson at Reid Park. Breakfast and wi-fi access are included with your room at the DoubleTree (if your room was booked by the SWC). The hotel is not within reasonable walking distance of campus, but a shuttle service will be available to go between the hotel and the lectures. Please see the directions page for details.

Working sessions

There will be evening working sessions at 7:30 pm on Saturday, Sunday, Monday, and Tuesday evenings. The working sessions will provide students with an opportunity to discuss their projects with the speakers, as well as a chance for everyone to get more details or clarifications from the speakers. Active participation by all participants is strongly encouraged. The evening working sessions will take place at the Doubletree Hotel. On Saturday night, they will be in the Junior Ballroom and the Cottonwood; on the other nights, in the Grand Ballroom. (Though the sessions begin at 7:30 pm, the rooms are reserved from 6 pm if you wish to get an early start.)

Evening of Arrival

There will be an informal gathering in the Junior Ballroom of the DoubleTree Hotel on Friday, March 8 from 6 pm to 10 pm.

Registration

Local registration for the conference will take place at the Junior Ballroom Foyer at the DoubleTree Hotel on Friday evening to 5 pm to 8 pm, and again on campus from 8 am to 10 am Saturday morning in the area outside of McClelland 207. You can get expense reimbursement forms and pay the registration and banquet fees at these times.

Coffee

Coffee will be available 30 minutes before the lectures start each morning. Coffee and snacks will be available during the between-lecture breaks.

Banquet

The conference banquet will be on Wednesday, March 13 at the DoubleTree. The gathering begins at 6:00 with a cash bar. The cost is $20 for participants, thanks to a subsidy from the Department of Mathematics, and $40 for guests. Payment will be taken at registration. If you would like to attend, please sign up no later than Friday, March 8. More details can be found on the signup page.

Free Afternoon

The afternoon of Monday, March 11 is a free afternoon. Excursions to Sabino Canyon and the Arizona-Sonora Desert Museum are planned. If you would like to participate in one of the excursions, please sign up no later than Friday, March 8.
